sen.j: 道昭（どうしょう、道照とも。舒明天皇元年（629年）- 文武天皇4年3月10日 (旧暦)（700年4月3日））は、河内国（現・大阪府）丹比郡船連（ふねのむらじ）出身の法相宗の僧侶である。
sen.e: Dosho (629 - April 3, 700) was a priest of the Hosso sect and he was born at Funenomuraji, Tajihi County, Kawachi Province (present Osaka Prefecture).
Dosho (629 - April 3, 700) was a priest of the Hosso sect and he was born at Funenomuraji, Tajihi County, Kawachi Province (present Osaka Prefecture).

sen.j: 白雉4年（653年）、遣唐使の一員として入唐し、玄奘に師事して法相教学を学ぶ。
sen.e: In 653 he entered Tang as a member of Kento-shi (Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China) and learned the Dharmalogy of the Hosso Study by Genjo.
In 653 he went to Tang as a member of Kento-shi (Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China) and learned the Dharmalogy of the Hosso Study under Genjo (Xuan Zang).

sen.j: 玄奘はこの異国の学僧を大切にし、同室で暮らしながら指導をしたという。
sen.e: It is said that Genjo treated this foreign learned priest pursuing his studies well and taught him with living in the same room.
It is said that Genjo treated this learned priest from a foreign country with respect and coached him even sharing a living room of the cell.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。

sen.j: 摂大乗論教学を学んだという記録もあるが、摂大乗論に関する注釈は残っていない。
sen.e: Although there is a record that Dosho learned Shodaijoron kyogaku (education and leaning on the commentary of Mahayana Buddhism), there left no commentary on Shodaijoron.

sen.j: 年時不明、玄奘の紹介で隆化寺の恵満に参禅し、経論若干を携えて帰朝。
sen.e: At one time which is unclear, he practiced Zen meditation at Keiman (恵満) of the Ryuke-ji Temple by an introduction of Genjo and went back to Japan with some sutras.
Sometime during his stay in Tang, he practiced Zen meditation under Keiman (Hui Man) at Ryuka-ji Temple (Longhuasi) on the introduction of Genjo, and returned to Japan with some sutras and papers.

sen.j: この時将来した多くの経典類は、平城遷都後、平城右京の禅院に移されて重用された。
sen.e: Many sutras which were brought at this time were moved to a Zen temple of Ukyo district in Heijo-kyo after the transfer of the capital and treated as important sutras.
sen.cmt: 「将来」は「請来」の誤記と判断しました。

sen.cmt: 簡略化。「将来」はそのままで間違いではありません。（小さな国語辞典に載っていないかもしれません）

sen.j: 年時不明、法興寺（別名飛鳥寺・元興寺）の一隅に禅院を建立して住み、日本法相教学の初伝となった（南寺伝）。
sen.e: At one time which is unclear, he had a Zen temple built at the corner of the Hoko-ji Temple (another name, the Asuka-dera Temple or the Gango-ji Temple), lived there, and got shoden (first degree) of the Dharmalogy of the Hosso Study in Japan.

Sometime after returning, he built a Zen temple in Hoko-ji Temple (also called Asuka-dera Temple or Gango-ji Temple), lived there, and taught the Dharmalogy of the Hosso Study for the first time in Japan (according to "Nanji-den").
sen.cmt: 誤訳に対応しました。オリジナルがおかしな文章ですが、この場合の「初伝」は初めて伝えたという意味。

sen.j: 680年、天武天皇の勅命を受けて、往生院 (泉南市)を建立する。
sen.e: In 680 he had the Ojoin Temple (Sennan City) built by an order of the Emperor Tenmu.
In 680 he built Ojoin Temple (Sennan City) by direct order of the Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。

sen.j: 晩年は全国を遊行し、各地で土木事業を行った。
sen.e: In his later years, he traveled around all over the county and implemented engineering works in various places.
In his later years, he traveled around the county and conducted public works at many regions.

sen.j: 700年に没した際、遺命により、日本で初めて火葬に付された。
sen.e: When he was died in 700, he was cremated by his will for the first time in Japan.
